title: George Wilson (Yorkshire cricketer)
text:
George Arthur Wilson (2 February 1916 – 24 September 2002) was an English <a href="Amateur%20status%20in%20first-class%20cricket">amateur</a> <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a>er, who played fifteen matches for <a href="Yorkshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Yorkshire County Cricket Club</a> between 1936 and 1939.
Born in <a href="Whitkirk">Whitkirk</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>, Wilson scored 352 runs at 17.60 and, bowling slow left-arm, took one wicket for 138. His highest score of 55 not out came against <a href="Northamptonshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Northamptonshire</a>, at <a href="North%20Marine%20Road%20Ground%2C%20Scarborough">North Marine Road Ground, Scarborough</a> in 1938, when he added an unbroken 84 for the sixth wicket with his <a href="Captain%20%28cricket%29">captain</a>, <a href="Brian%20Sellers">Brian Sellers</a>.
Wilson played his early cricket with Whitkirk C.C., and subsequently graduated to the Bradford League with Saltaire C.C. and Windhill C.C. He was a businessman in Leeds, before retiring to <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a>.
He died in September 2002 in Oxford, aged 86.
